RT @agricontract: Im sick of flooding can the @EnvAgency please look at what the Dutch to control rain fall remember you used to be called‚Ä¶

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay This farmer has dug trenches into a chalk stream to allow muck and rain to drain. He has filled the ditch because he knew it was wrong but made no attempt to bund or stop further run off. He does not care. It is your job to protect the environment!

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay ‚Ä¢ use tracks across the contour where possible
‚Ä¢ regularly divert run-off into field margins or soak away areas to prevent build-up of run-off down
slopes
‚Ä¢ reduce numbers on high risk steep slopes particularly in the winter
‚Ä¢ rotate to avoid severe compaction.

text: Just seen the ITV London news report on the sad & upsetting state of the Welsh Harp. Went there as a kid as my aunt lived nearby. Looks nothing like it did back then & to see it like it did on television is a disgrace. Needs urgent action. @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/ZZpyLaNEQa

text: @cutlerstom @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency It very much depends on soil, underlying geology, cover and what field drains discharge into (upper catchment ditch, lowland river or fen drain). Drains are needed for arable cropping but I see many arable fields that flood and erode because they really should be floodplain

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay Taken from The Guide to Cross Compliance 2020: To limit soil erosion you can:
‚Ä¢ lay out paddocks so as not to channel run-off
‚Ä¢ move pigs onto well established grass
‚Ä¢ use large troughs to reduce soil damage
‚Ä¢ use grass strips to intercept run-off

@agricontract @EnvAgency We're predicting drier summers - where's your water storage going to be?
If we straighten and canalise watercourses, we reduce the overall length of the water channel and the area of its edge (where water drains in). We've made our own problem

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay the Environment Agency state that they are not responsible for regulation of outdoor pig units. This is clearly cross compliance and it has been going on for months. Ask EA for full details of when this was reported.
@hslyfarms @cutlerstom @NrtSam @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency üòé

text: @mortonmassive @agricontract @EnvAgency I drive past a field most days and have done for years. When ploughed it produced crap crops. It‚Äôs in year 3 min till, last year the rape was patchy but bad autumn for sowing. This year it‚Äôs oats and looking the best I have ever seen.

@EnvAgencyAnglia The picture he supplied were from both dates - before and after. Filling in a ditch does NOT make any amends for the damage caused to the river. Stop making excuses for him. He has been warned  and should have bunded that field in early December. More rain forecast. More runoff.

@essexwindyfarm @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency @JanetHughes Plenty of farmers are expecting to shift increased volumes off their land more quickly and then complaining that the EA aren't doing anything.
